intro: Wilcoxia diguetii, commonly known as the Atacama Desert flower, is a rare and resilient plant native to the hyperarid regions of Chile. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, cruciform flowers. The plant has adapted to extreme conditions by developing a deep root system and reduced leaf surface area. It is often found growing in rocky soils and can survive with minimal water. Due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
